title: Getting Started with TypeScript
content: TypeScript is a strongly typed programming language that builds on JavaScript. In this post, we'll cover the basics of TypeScript and how to set up your first project.

title: React Router Fundamentals
content: React Router is a standard library for routing in React. It enables the navigation among views of various components in a React Application, allows changing the browser URL, and keeps the UI in sync with the URL.

title: State Management in React
content: Managing state is one of the hardest parts of any application. This post explores various state management solutions in React including Context API, Redux, and Zustand.

title: Building REST APIs with Express
content: Express is a minimal and flexible Node.js web application framework that provides a robust set of features for web and mobile applications. In this tutorial, we'll build a RESTful API using Express and TypeScript.

title: CSS-in-JS Solutions Compared
content: There are many ways to style React components. In this post, we compare popular CSS-in-JS libraries like styled-components, emotion, and tailwind CSS to help you choose the right one for your project.
